channel.title: numpy on Memo Tut
channel.description: Recent content in numpy on Memo Tut

item.title: [Python] Denoising method using wavelet transform
item.description: There was a noise removal method that I was convinced that there is a method like this in the kaggle kernel (notebook now), so I will summarize the things I examined about it below with notes. Method overview An analysis method for a certain signal or waveform is called wavelet transform. I think that I often imagine the Fourier transform as an analysis method, but the Fourier transform expands the waveform to the sum of trigonometric functions (Sain, Kosain), whereas the wavelet transform decomposes it into a waveform of any shape.

item.title: [Python] Numpy 100 List of functions that I thought with 100 knocks that I thought This is convenient,
item.description: # Overview I was made to work on 100 knocks of Numpy during the training of the company, but there were many problems that I could not defeat unless I knew the function in the first place, and I realized the lack of knowledge. In this article, I will introduce some of the functions I’ve met for the first time that I find useful, as well as a memorandum.

item.title: [Python] A summary of all the Python visualization tools used by active graduate students in their research [Application]
item.description: #Continuing from the previous session This article is an application of Python visualization tools. ~~ Since it has become long, I decided to divide the application into two. (Application 2 is still being written) ~~ The application section was added to this article to make it one. If you are new to Python plot, I wrote the basic version last time, so please check here! #Introduction I am currently a graduate student with a 2nd year master’s degree.

item.title: [Python] A summary of all Python plots used by active graduate students in their research [Basic]
item.description: Application section [here](https://qiita.com/coffiego/items/dfabde5f8588723b32d6) https://qiita.com/coffiego/items/dfabde5f8588723b32d6 #Introduction I am currently a graduate student with a 2nd year master’s degree. I am studying the Martian atmosphere using numerical simulation. Since I mainly analyzed the results obtained by numerical simulation using Python, I tried to summarize all the functions used in the process. Please note that this is not an exhaustive list. .. .. However, since I’ve been struggling to use the documentation, I’ve summarized it in the hope that if anyone using Python’s visualization tools can help with that!

item.title: [Python] Is the New Corona really a threat? Verified with Stan (was)
item.description: [Notice] [Sequel](https://qiita.com/akeyhero/items/a8aa2d3db2c32c867ff6) is used to determine the lethality rate of COVID-19. Purpose Verify if COVID-19’s lethality is really high Try the stochastic programming language Stan What is a probabilistic programming language? It is a programming language that solves nicely by describing statistical relationships (models). As an implementation, it seems to sample by Markov chain Monte Carlo method. It is not a replacement for the procedural programming language because it has a completely different role and method.

item.title: [Python] Scatter rice grains to determine pi (Monte Carlo method)
item.description: # Addition This is an article that implements the Monte Carlo method. I forgot completely. 1.First of all When I was reading a book for children’s statistics [1], I saw an article about spreading rice grains to calculate the pi. It seemed interesting, so I tried to calculate the pi using the randomly generated x, y coordinate data. [procedure] It’s almost like this Prepare a square and a circle inscribed in it.

item.title: [Python] Qiita, early Python♪
item.description: "I want to start Python programming, but what should I do?" I often get the question, so I tried to put together a Qiita page for beginners. Initially Python syntax How to use Numpy How to use Pandas How to use matplotlib I think it is good to take a look at all four. Python syntax Python warming up Python Basic Summary Python basic learning How to use #Numpy

item.title: [Python] Don't write Python if you want to speed it up
item.description: ## Introduction I decided to give a Lightning Talk about Python at work, so I’ll write something that can be read in about 5 minutes. The talk theme is “Knowledge when trying to speed up in Python”. **This isn’t an article about Python. ** Target of this article This article is for the following people: Python beginner People who are interested in Python but think that it seems not to be speed Immediate conclusion As the title says, don’t write Python (as much as possible) if you want to speed it up.

item.title: [Python] NumPy basics
item.description: Features of #NumPy Compute multidimensional arrays all at once. ndarray: multidimensional array object ndarray example import numpy as np data = np.random.randn(2,3) # random number with 2 columns and 3 rows print(data) # [[-0.4440664 -0.07889544 -0.84781375] # [0.59333292 -0.03008522 1.54106015]] print(data * 10) # multiply # [[-4.44066398 -0.78895438 -8.47813747] # [5.93332925 -0.3008522 15.41060155]] print(data + data) # addition # [[-0.8881328 -0.15779088 -1.69562749] # [1.18666585 -0.06017044 3.

item.title: [Python] Statistics with python
item.description: # Total and average numpy.sum(data) # sum numpy.mean(data) # mean #Maximum, minimum, and median numpy.amax(data) numpy.amin(data) numpy.median(data) #dispersion An index that indicates how far the data is from the average \sigma^2=\frac{1}{N}\sum_{i=1}^{n} (x_i-\mu)^2 numpy.var(data, ddof = 0) Unbiased distribution The sample variance is a value obtained by further calculating the variance using the sample mean, but this value causes an underestimate bias. Therefore, the one without bias becomes the universal variance.

item.title: [Python] Python: 3D array image (numpy.array)
item.description: I'm not good at imagining a 3D array of numpy with my head, where does axis=1 point? Like so every time, I will summarize my own understanding. Below, "array" refers to np.array. Trigger In “Essence of Machine Learning” (Author: Koichi Kato), when there is a two-dimensional array X with seven two-dimensional vectors and a two-dimensional array cluster_centers with three two-dimensional vectors, the distance between the two vectors is squared. The calculation for brute force was done as follows (extracted from the third edition pp.

item.title: [Python] Master the comprehension
item.description: #What is a comprehension Notation that can be used when creating lists and dictionaries in python. Since the for loop is slow in python, comprehension can be used to make a list or dictionary faster when creating a list or dictionary. Basic When making a list like this. new_list = [f(myiter) for myiter in origin_list] You can create a dictionary by replacing [] with {}. new_dict = (indexes[myiter]:f(myiter) \ for myiter in origin_list} The basic pattern is as follows.

item.title: [Python] How to speed up Pandas apply method with just one sentence (with verification calculation)
item.description: #Conclusion Just add swifter method before Pandas apply method Concrete example import pandas as pd import numpy as np import swifter # Create a suitable DataFrame df = pd.DataFrame({'col': np.random.normal(size=10000000)}) # Add swifter method before apply method. %time df['col2'] = df['col'].swifter.apply(lambda x: x**2) # Wall time: 50 ms # For comparison (normal pandas apply method) %time df['col2'] = df['col'].apply(lambda x: x**2) # Wall time: 3.48 s How to install $ pip install -U pandas # upgrade pandas $ pip install swifter In case of ```terminal:conda $ conda update pandas # upgrade pandas $ conda install -c conda-forge swifter

item.title: [Python] What to do when `Object arrays cannot be loaded when allow_pickle=False` occurs in numpy.load()
item.description: - numpy 1.16.3 以降 現象 Pythonコードの例 np.load('/path/to/file.npy') 発生するエラーの例 - -------------------------------------------------------------------------- ValueError Traceback (most recent call last) <ipython-input-37-1db66562b57b> in <module> - ---> 1 np.load('tmp.npy') ~/venv/aep/lib/python3.7/site-packages/numpy/lib/npyio.py in load(file, mmap_mode, allow_pickle, fix_imports, encoding) 451 else: 452 return format.read_array(fid, allow_pickle=allow_pickle, - -> 453 pickle_kwargs=pickle_kwargs) 454 else: 455 # Try a pickle ~/venv/aep/lib/python3.7/site-packages/numpy/lib/format.py in read_array(fp, allow_pickle, pickle_kwargs) 720 # The array contained Python objects. We need to unpickle the data. 721 if not allow_pickle: - -> 722 raise ValueError("Object arrays cannot be loaded when " 723 "allow_pickle=False") 724 if pickle_kwargs is None: ValueError: Object arrays cannot be loaded when allow_pickle=False 原因 numpy v1.

item.title: [Python] [Memorandum] Python calculation speedup (may be) module Numba related summary
item.description: I want to run a #Python program at high speed! ** “If you can calculate 10 times faster, you can make 10 times more failures” ** If you think so, everyone should think that it would be good to be able to calculate quickly. As for the title, Numba, it is a module that can accelerate the calculation on Python by using JIT (just-in-time) compiler. This article is a memorandum of past excellent articles about Numba.

item.title: [Python] Is there a NaN in the pandas DataFrame?
item.description: I searched for a while and couldn't find it, so I managed to figure out how to put it out, so I took a note. The subject is “Is there a NaN in the pandas DataFrame?” As a simple check that the data is processed properly, I want to check the NaN value in the data frame and where it is. If you want to fill/delete NaN, you can use fillna()/dropna(), but what I want to do now is “Check if there is a NaN and display that row (column).

item.title: [Python] Implemented PRML algorithm in Python (almost Numpy only)
item.description: I will implement the method published in PRML in Python for my own study (machine learning algorithm and Python study). As a general rule, in the algorithm part, in addition to the Python standard library, Only Numpy can be used. Machine learning packages such as scikit-learn and tensorflow are not used. Packages that show results such as matplotlib will be used unless they are related to the implementation of the algorithm.

item.title: [Python] Get the value closest to a value from a Python list element
item.description: Note that I took a little time to retrieve the closest value from a certain value in the list with Python. Failure example I saw how to use numpy’s searchsorted function on the net, but this function inserts a value into the list Since it is a function that returns the index when doing, it does not necessarily return the index of the value closest to a certain value.
